case_vignette: A previously healthy 16-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his parents for evaluation because of extreme irritability, fatigue, and loss of appetite for 3 weeks! Five months ago, his grandfather, whom he was very close to, passed away from chronic lymphocytic leukemia! He used to enjoy playing soccer but quit his soccer team last week! When he comes home from school he goes straight to bed and sleeps for 11–12 hours each night! He previously had good grades, but his teachers report that he has been disrespectful and distracted in class and failed an exam last week! He tried alcohol twice at a party last year and he has never smoked cigarettes! Vital signs are within normal limits! On mental status examination, he avoids making eye contact but cooperates with the exam! His affect is limited and he describes an irritable mood! He is easily distracted and has a difficult time focusing for an extended conversation!
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling extremely irritable, tired, and I've lost my appetite for the last 3 weeks.
Have you noticed any changes in your weight recently?
Yes, I have lost weight recently due to my loss of appetite.
Do you have a history of any psychiatric or emotional disorders such as depression or anxiety?
No, I do not have a history of psychiatric or emotional disorders.
Are you currently experiencing any other symptoms such as fever, night sweats, or swollen lymph nodes?
No, I am not experiencing symptoms like fever, night sweats, or swollen lymph nodes.
Do you have any difficulty in sleeping or changes in your sleeping pattern?
Yes, I've been sleeping a lot more than usual, going straight to bed when I come home from school and sleeping for 11–12 hours each night.
What is your age and gender?
I am a 16-year-old boy.
Have you experienced any significant life changes or stressors recently?
Yes, my grandfather, whom I was very close to, passed away from chronic lymphocytic leukemia five months ago.
Final Diagnosis: Depression
